Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: tmcmaus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Camino Real Santa Fe hotel for a week while on a business trip to Mexico City. The staff were very helpful and friendly with nothing being too much trouble. We used the business facilities and held some meetings and demonstrations in the hotel as well. Our room was spacious enough for our time there. We used the buffet breakfast each morning and would recommend that to visitors. given we will be returning to Mexico City on a regular basis we will be happy to book into this hotel again. We found it to be convenient and close ennough to many great restaurants. Then again, our Mexican hosts did provide all our transport so that did make it easier for us to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Very good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mutiny
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be a very good business hotel in the newer business district of Mexico City. The rooms are very large and spacious and that bathrooms are large too. The staff were very friendly, efficient and pleasant-natured. The breakfast buffet was superb. It is a shame that Santa Fe is so far away from the historical centre as I would have liked to have walked around there - but when someone else is paying the bill, you accept where they accommodate you. The meeting facilities were also very good.

Reviews.Title: “a real 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarcoB59
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, staff very friendly (and they speak English), very modern, fantastic breakfast and a very honest price for a 4* hotel. Two negative spots: no swimming pool and wi-fi expensive and not really good in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: knbn
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel. Good service. Have stayed several times on business.Price is similar to other properties in this area. Very good breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “I will not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: PPCancun
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks pretty but the look isn't everything. They charge you for the Internet a lot of money. Even for local calls they charge you. The food at the restaurant is good but expensive too. The place is located in a nice area in Mexico you can take a cab for like 3 USD to take to Santa Fe Mall, which is the biggest in Latin America, it is really impressive. You can have dinner on the tons of places aroud the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and friendly service, trouble with their internet makes less business-friendly”
Reviews.Author: CULovetotravel
Reviews.Content: I'm staying here, and the room is very nice and modern. Everybody I have had contact with is very polite and friendly, and the restaurants are good. I specially like the terrace at Bice. That being said the Internet is very crappy. The service comes down every 10 minutes. Also, I went into the jacuzzi last night, and when I turned on the propellers a lot of dirt came out. It probably had not been used in a while, and therefore was very dirty. This hotel still has smoking floors, and I can feel some cigarette smell coming in from the bathroom. Overall very good, but should fix the Internet. The other things are relatively minor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Commercial district of Santa Fe during the week”
Reviews.Author: Onda99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very new and the rooms and all facilities are modern and comfortable. The hotel is a good choice if you have to visit one of the US or European companies in the district. It is very near to the offices of Microsoft, IBM, HP, SAP and rioght opposite of the German Center. Around the hotel you can find many good restaurants and the roof top bar and restaurant kyo is absoplutely worth visiting. The hotel features a spa and a fitness center but no swimming pool. An ATM is right next to the hotel and executive taxi service is offered 24/7. The concierge service is also very good and any tours around the city can be organized easily. Only problem is that the area is completely abandoned on the weekend - especially on Sundays. Located near some busy streets you should try to get a room in one of the top floors - but the noise is acceptable during night hours...

Reviews.Title: “Yes, I would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Worldtravelleraust
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant when our trip advisor said we would get better value here rather than next door at the Sheraton. Normally that means less service at a lower cost. I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. The staff were cheerful and helpful from the outset. We had a team meeting and the attending hotel staff could not have been more service oriented or helpful, right down to getting fresh hot water every time I wanted a cup of tea! Meals were of a high quality. The rooms were large and very clean but I agree with the earlier reviewer who complained that the room lighting was poorly designed and needs to be improved - but yes, this is a minor issue given the overall impression I have of this hotel. Please keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay on the 12th floor”
Reviews.Author: kjfehn
Reviews.Content: This is good hotel in a very nice area of Mexico City - very safe and clean. A great location for a business traveler. Tourists may not like the location since it is far away from sightseeing. The food was really good, the service was good, and the prices were good. The hotel room was dark in the morning due to there not being enough lights in the room. The bathrooms were great. If you like sleeping to the sound of music thumping through the floor, then stay on the 12th floor underneath the Sky bar. Otherwise, stay way from the 12th floor! The Sky bar is very nice, but there is not much sound insulation in this building.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Santa Fe business district”
Reviews.Author: Dansladen
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I stayed at this hotel since I stopped using the Sheraton Suites next door. This hotel is approx. 2 years old and is centrally located in the Santa Fe business district. Overall this is a great hotel for business people. Service is always top notch and the rooms are large and comfortable. In all, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel for business travelers. Nonetheless, if you are a tourist, this is not the best area to stay, as there are no tourist attractions and you would be better served by staying in the "Reforma" downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel, excellent Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Fischgericht
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the hotel is the excellent breakfast buffet really. The rooms are quite big, however quite dark due to missing light sources. Windows do not open sadly. Wireless LAN didn't work (Access point went out of service after a few hours after check-in) - but that's pretty common for Hotels in Mexico really. Staff is very friendly, service is good. TV is quite old (CRT instead of a flat-screen), but on the other hand it actually provides working cable TV, which again is not something to be granted in mexican Hotels. When it comes to the value, things could be better - it's quite expensive, and neither WLAN nor Breakfast are included in standard rates. But then again, price level is high in Santa Fe for most hotels. What's really sad is that there is advertising for their sky lounge everywhere, but it's still closed for reconstruction (and reading other reviews here that's the case for quite some time already). It would be fair not to advertise this on their website while it's not accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Typical mediocre business hotel”
Reviews.Author: MTL1969
Reviews.Content: Really nothing to get excited about- the only reason to stay here is if you have business nearby. It is about an hour from any of the attractions in Mexico City. The rooms don;t have any windows that open (who designs these hotels? this is a common problem in 'modern' hotels) and the wireless internet signal in teh room was too weak to be functional. Had to ask for a cable. On top of that you need to pay for internet, and get a new code everyday (another scam that should end- in a simply family hotel where i just stayed in Mexico City (at 1/3 of the price) the wireless Internet was free and worked a charm)

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: rolandcha
Reviews.Content: Overall a decent hotel, but I have to submit a negative review because of bed bugs. This review is based on two recent stays. Got bed bug bites on the second stay. Cons: -Bed bugs -Room lighting inadequate -Need a new code for wireless internet each day -Housekeeping doesn't do a very good job of making the bed -They knock on your door in the morning 15 minutes before your actual wake up call -Roof-top bar is currently under construction -Concierge gives horrible walking directions (even in Spanish) to nearby restaurants Pros: -Decent gym (according to colleague) -Excellent, but overpriced breakfast buffet -Decent business center -Good location in Santa Fe; close to restaurants, Starbucks, 7-11 (product selection is limited at this location) -Good shower water pressure -Easy-to-use alarm clock Overall, I would have rated this hotel 4 out of 5 if it wasn't for the bed bugs, and it is for this reason alone that I do not recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice from Outside but dont worth it inf you stay”
Reviews.Author: FLL_Charlie
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very expensive and the service is very poor in comparison with their neighborghs (Sheraton, Fiesta Americana and Fiesta Inn). The Front Desk people and the bell boys dont share all the informations, the taxis are very very expensive and also they charge you an extra fee. Room Services is fast but bad quality and the food is cold in additions the prices of room services are more than expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, modern but weird room decor”
Reviews.Author: Atul1998
Reviews.Content: Landed bleary eyed on the red-eye from Sao Paulo, check into the room, which was spacious, looked brand new, although hotel is 5 plus years old. Room ergonomics were odd and same for the bathroom.... Excellent breakfast/restaurant with attentive and plenty of staff who are quite energetic - attracting a lot of business professionals. Might stay at the american hotel chain next door if i had a choice

Reviews.Title: “Good service. Good restaurant for breakfast. Poor room lighting.”
Reviews.Author: kiawahvilla
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the JWMarriott (Polanco), but chose the Camino Real Santa Fe because it was convenient for business. The Camino Real Santa Fe is not a grand hotel. Rooms are simple, modern and comfortable; although the dim lighting is more appropriate in a spa than in a business hotel! We had no problem with service. When we ordered morning coffee, it was delivered to our room in under five minutes. Breakfast buffet (about $20 USD) in the Bice restaurant was excellent. The business center was helpful, and the gym very good. The location of the Camino Real Santa Fe is pleasant and near all sorts of modern restaurants, suburban amenities, and offices; however, is not especially good for tourists to Mexico City. There is lots of interesting (some spectacular) modern architecture; but there is no "old Mexico" charm, as this is a recently developed area focused on office space. As others have noted, the staff in general speaks less English than the staff at some hotels more centrally located for tourism.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: JonnyOC
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite business hotels. It is a great location for me (I can walk to our office from here). It is in the business distict, and a very short cab ride to a nice shopping mall (if you need this). there are several restaurants close by, and I usually go out for dinner, but the dinner at the restaurant is nice (a bit expensive, though). I usually go to starbucks for breakfast, and there is one a short walk from the hotel. They have a GREAT workout facility, and that is one of the main reasons I like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: ontheotherside
Reviews.Content: The Camino Real Santa Fe is a convenient business hotel if your meetings are taking place in the Santa Fe neighborhood. The interior design is very pleasant (see bedroom picture), and the food, very good. I did not experience issues with customer service as reported by other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good price qualtiy”
Reviews.Author: Kleine-genieter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Camino Real for the second time now and sure the service is not the best, it has improved a lot. This hotel is just recently bought by the Camino Real group, so the management is still "working" on improving the service I feel. The rooms are nice, clean and fairly spacious. The shower/bathroom is fine. The location is great if you need to be in Santa Fe, if you want to go to the center, it is indeed pretty far. Over the weekend Santa Fe is dead, there is nothing to do, so this might not be your preferred hotel to stay during that time. Overall the hotel was priced reasonable, I booked it over Expedia and paid $70 per night, really good price, it even included free internet. Just be careful, because all the rest is extra, minibar, water, breakfast, parking, nothing is included, and if you need any of these items, the price runs up fast. For my stay, two nights, I was happy with the overall service. The check out time could indeed be better and more efficient.

Reviews.Title: “oblivious to what costumer care is.....”
Reviews.Author: garmarin
Reviews.Content: I never have the time or desire to write a hotel review except for this time. I think is fair that everybody that is considering this place to lodge should know some facts and the inability of this people to solve issues. I rented a room for 1 night along with my family of 3. I was waken up at 1:30 in am from the kitchen to ask â€œdid you order an ice coolerâ€�. I was half a sleep and told the caller I found hard to re-engage in sleep after this interruption. The captain in charge re-called me at 1:45 to check if I ordered a carbon soda service (what you order to mix whiskey) I was like,what the heck you are talking about man??. I ended up talking to the manager at night duty with million of apologies. I demanded that the guy that ordered the carbon soda service should be billed for my useless night in this crap of hotel. Of course in the morning the front desk manager gave me a million of apologies and told me that they can not do anything about the incident. Not even a courtesy breakfast. I was so upset that I decided not to waste my time with people that do not have knowledge of what costumer service is. So I recommend you to avoid this hotel at all causes and opt for an us chain instead. I got a nice bill for 198 us dollars a night.

Reviews.Title: “not perfect, but met my needs well”
Reviews.Author: djcn0te
Reviews.Content: This is a cool looking, new, modern hotel in the biz district of Santa Fe. Be aware that this is far removed from any tourist activities. Room was very clean, and cool design... although a bit akwardly arranged. Lighting was a bit poor in the room at night... during the day, floor to ceiling windows remedy. Nice shower. Very confortable bed... could be a bit firm for some. Air conditioning worked uncommonly well for Mexico. Breakfast buffet was quite good, and included in my room rate. Ask for the huevos con machaca. Room service was friendly and fast, but a bit on the expensive side, and didn't think it was of the best quality. Ordered Mexican plates.. possible that Italian would be better since it comes from Italian restaurant downstairs. Workout facilities were modern and well air conditioned, but only 3 treadmills.. had to wait to get on one. I don't care if there is a personal trainer (there was) but I hate to wait for a treadmill when I have to make a morning meeting. Checkout on Friday morning was a total drag. Had to wait in line 30 minutes, and they charged me for breakfast although it had been included in my room rate. It was handled professionally, but the wait was intolerable.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, modern, clean, good breakfast, excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: gregandcath
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a work trip to mexico city. The hotel is very modern and stylish, the rooms are large and the fit and finish is above average. The room we got had two double beds, a good size work table, a comfortable sitting chair, plenty of wadrobe space, an iron and board in room, a good size bathroom, with a shower and no bath. the shower did leak into the toilet area which was annoying, room service was good - but the breakfast was excellent - one of the best hotel breakfast buffets ever. Its in Santa Fe which is a long (1/2 hour at least) drive from downtown, but its only a 2 minute tax ride from Santa Fe shopping centre, which is very nice. The area is very safe and clean and though a little boring (its the new part of the city) there are plenty of good restaurants and bars close by - even an english pub serving good english beer! Overall a nice modern hotel

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel for neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: curiousjayu
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a conference. The hotel is pretty new, and the staff is very attentive and polite. The rooms themselves are very "mod" - a bit on the dark side, for my taste, but lots of nice fixtures. Santa Fe is FAR from the center of Mexico City, but if you have to be in this neighborhood for work, it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, few kinks to work out”
Reviews.Author: traveler223
Reviews.Content: Hotel Vesta is located in the very new Santa Fe area. The hotel is modern and extremely clean. Staff is friendly and while there are a good number that don't speak english, they make a strong effort to communicate with you and meet your needs. There are some kinks with the hotel- because it is so new, the Sky Bar on the room isn't open yet, there is no pool and the outdoor area of the restaurant is still being constructed. The hotel has terrible water pressure and hot water was often a problem but I learned that if you called the front desk they had some mysterious trick to turn it up remotely. The bar area is on the small side. But overall the hotel was very nice- comfortable beds, turn down service, robe and slippers, furniture built into wall. One tip....there is a cord on the far left of the curtains to open/close them. Trust me, after many attempts at tugging the curtains, you'll be happy to know this.

HotelInfo.Name: Camino Real Santa Fe Mexico
HotelInfo.Address: Guillermo Gonzalez Camarena #300 | Santa Fe City Center, Mexico City 01210, Mexico
